comments.body: Minor nit, no need to change: Generally I would only put package documentation in a doc.go file if it was a substantial documentation or there were several files in the package that would make finding it hard. Here it's fairly short, and there's only one non-test go file.

Ack. There is just one file for now. Will add more code in future PRs.
This comment is for anyone else who might be looking at the code and wondering if their code should go in this package.
